Francis Yang

Software developer, specializing in game develop and web develop

Currently living in San Francisco Bay Area

@izayacity
I am a 24 years old developer who had been coding since 18. I lived and worked in Beijing and Tokyo before but I wanna challenge myself at a higher level. I enjoy writing code, working with great people, making friends with people all over the world and learning different cultures. That's why I come to North America. My current interests are:

Go

Go is my current favorite language in addition to Swift because of its beautiful and concise grammar, and its efficiency. I used it to make data visualization by GQL and memcache on GAE, and currently I'm using it to practice Leetcode on Github. Actually I can also play board game go as I learnt at school for a year at the age of 10.

C++

C++ is the language I used the longest so far as my undergraduate university mainly used it for computer science courses since freshman year. I have developed on several C++ frameworks or game engines like QT, Snort, SFML, Unreal Engine 4, Cocos 2d-x, etc.

PHP

I began to write my first PHP program in my sophomore year and had been developed on LAMP, WAMP and MAMP. During my internship in Tokyo, I developed a management system independently using Slim framework.

Javascript

Javascript is also my favourite language as it is multi-platform and could be used in functional paradigm. I had experience with jQuery, Ionic (based on AngularJS), Bootstrap, ThreeJS, ChartJS, MetroJS, etc. By using JS, I could develop cool things like AJAX and data visualization (by parsing JWT from database).

Python

Python is my first script language when I developed a DNS parser with it in my junior year during college. Then during my first internship in Beijing, I was developing under Django framework. After I went to another department to help with my graduation paper on cyber-security research, I still used Python scripts to test data automatically, which surprised my manager and thus got recommendation.

Linux

I began to work with several Linux systems such as Ubuntu, CentOS, OpenSUSE, since sophomore year. Because of network engineering major and cyber-security research during college, I had been using Ubuntu from 11.04 to 14.10. Currently I'm only using Mac OSX. But those Linux experiences make me type commands easily in any Linux or Unix Terminal CLS.

Game develop

I'm currently reading a M.Sci degree on Games and Playable Media in UC Santa Cruz. During fall quarter, I cooperated in designing and developing Hive, a 3D 3rd-person VR hacking game by Unity3d on Oculus Rift in a pair. I also made Connect-4, Poker, Pong, Breakout, Asteroids by C++ using SFML. In the following quarters, I would be the technical director in a team of 4 people and artists from SJSU to develop Tornado Tower, A 3D 3rd-person VR platformer game by Unreal Engine 4 on Oculus Rift.

Server

I had experience with both physic server and cloud server. I was researching network engineering and cyber-security during college as well as my internship in Beijing, so I'm equipped with knowledge of network protocols, data packets analysis, and cyber-security knowledge. With my development experience on GAE and AWS in Tokyo, I could deploy applications on those cloud platforms independently. I also knew how to develop web application with cyber-security consideration. I ran my website on AWS before as well.

Project management

I'm equipped with knowledge and experience of software engineering, UML documentation, Agile development and management. I also developed management systems for both of my internship companies in Beijing and Tokyo. My favourite tools are Atlassian SourceTree, Bitbucket, and Jira. Although I am capable of project management, I'm also a team player with professional working ethic as I was working at Beijing in Nsfocus with 1000+ people and branches globally, and I was working at Tokyo in a Japanese company who is famous for manner.

My expectations ?

Humane workplace and working culture.
A financal well-being company that purcuits high quality products and values user experience.
A strong team of programmers.
The chance of using new technologies and proposing project plans.
The chance of getting promotion and switching workplace cities.
A company that cares about foreign employees.
Don't hesitate to contact me at izayacity@gmail.com or xyang42@ucsc.edu.
